Key Match Events: Shohei Ohtani hit a go-ahead two-run homer in the bottom of the fifth
Teoscar Hernandez hit a go-ahead solo shot in the sixth
Mookie Betts hit a 100mph fastball over the left-field wall to give the Dodgers a 6-5 lead and the win in the ninth inning
Pre-Game Insights: The Dodgers are still determined to stay ahead of the San Diego Padres and clinch the National League West division title.

Given the stark contrast between the Rockies and Dodgers, LA had the option of sitting back, relaxing and focusing on the playoffs ahead. Instead, they attacked the series with the same energy and emotion as if it were the playoffs.
Post-Match Reflections: Dodger fans can only hope the team will maintain that mentality for clutch situations in October.
If he continues his clutch hitting, Hernandez could end up being the lineup addition that breaks the annual curse of Dodger bats freezing up in October.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Brusdar Graterol, Ryan Brasier, Joe Kelly, Daniel Hudson, Alex Vesia, Evan Phillips, Blake Treinen and Michael Kopech all threw an inning each in the bullpen game on Friday
Yoshinobu Yamamoto struggled early in the game on Sunday, leading to a 5-1 deficit early
